main event: An observer noticed a large silver object over Tipp City, Ohio, on July 3, 1953, that remained stationary for a time before moving vertically and disappearing to the south.
interesting points: The observation lasted for approximately 12 to 14 minutes., The observer was outside at the time of the sighting., The object was described as shiny and round., It moved rapidly upwards and then changed direction sharply to the south., Local inquiries found no evidence of a weather balloon in the vicinity at the time of the sighting.
witness description: The main witness was 25 years old, worked as an industrial operator, and was notified about the sighting while outside of his porch.
